newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Sinter soars, Apple off.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Sinter soars, Apple off.

text.p: Sinter Metals Inc shares traded sharply higher preceding Wednesday's U.S. market open on news Britain's GKN Plc plans to acquire the company for $37 per share, or $570 million, traders said.
Ahead of the market open, Sinter climbed 9-1/2 to 36-1/2, according to the traders.
GKN said shareholders representing 43 percent of Sinter's outstanding share have agreed to accept the bid.
Sinter, based in Cleveland, manufactures metal components for use in automobiles, appliances and power tools.

Apple Computer Inc shares slipped to 16-3/4 from 17-11/16 in early trade, a move traders attributed to Larry Ellison, chairman of Oracle Corp, announcing last night that he was putting off, for now, an attempt to gain control of Apple.
Ellison has for more than two years expressed an interest in acquiring Apple with his own money.

Also, Papa John's International Inc rose 1/2 to 25 after the pizza company reported first quarter earnings last night of $0.20 per share, $0.01 better than Wall Street expectations and $0.07 above year-ago results.
